author: abhiaiyer91
title: Stake Pool Operations Dashboard
description: 24/7 uptime requires alerting and monitoring to maintain. How can we give new operators awareness of top health metrics for their pool.

assessments.note: The proposal doesn't give any details on the data exporter,  the idea is good but not enough details have been provided.
The idea presented is to improve the quality of pool management and are not addressing the challenge from the point of view of developers but from the SPOs perspective.

Monitoring a stake pool can be useful for both the developer and user of a stake pool. There are software like this already created by cntools. I would like to know what you would like to monitor in detail, and how it would be different than what already exists.

This proposal does not directly address improving the developer ecosystem and attracting developers. It is operations oriented, and does not clearly differentiate itself from existing capabilities like those based on Grafana.

It is unclear how this proposal serves efficiently the challenge brief. It would help to add more detail so that it can be understood better. There is not enough information, cannot be invested in its current shape/form.
The proposer experience could be relevant, but unverifiable, we don't even. know if it's someone alone or a team.
irrelevent, if can't find existing tools.
There is no reasonable plan and there are not enough details to evaluate the proposer experience. I recommend that details are provided so that we can evaluate more appropriately.

Would be nice to have more concrete discussion on experience. It appears to be a single developer and not a team. Details on what sort of alerting/monitoring applications you have created in the past would be a great addition here.
The proposer has the requisite experience, but the proposal does not include specific KPIs or details on the nature of the data exports and supported dashboard tools.

Beyond couple of sentences - there is no real sense of executable proposal. It needs legs. It needs sensible plan, valid experience presentation, and budget with allocation that makes sense. Otherwise, this would be a blind endeavour. I suggest to work on it and come back at later stages.
Not enough informations are provided to judge the feasibility of the project.
The proposal is a draft and there is no information on how it will address the challenge. There is not enough information to judge the feasibility of the idea.
A plan, mile stones, roadmap, mock up visuals and more is required here in my opinion to see exactly what the proposer has in mind.
The proposal does not provide justification for its budget or details about the type of data export and tools supported.

In order for this to be a serious proposal, it needs work on roadmap and milestones. We also need to understand how authors approach success - what will they use to measure it, which KPIs, and if they are thinking about challenges or risks. These are just few key elements which would help alleviate concerns greatly. I suggest looking up mentorship program on catalyst discord to leverage some of that resource to help you.

solution: We can provide operators a data exporter to be consumed by their dashboarding tool of choice.
experience: I have been engineering in the cloud systems space for multiple years. We use alerting and metrics to keep SaaS products up 99% of the time.
